Package com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers

Interface AutoShutdownExecutorService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Executor, ExecutorService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StealingCallbackExecutor
    public interface AutoShutdownExecutorService
extends ExecutorService
    An interface that specifies an ExecutorService that can shut down automatically when the JVM terminates gracefully. It contains methods to view the auto-shutdown status and allow/disallow it to shut down automatically.
    Author:
    DELIBURD

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addShutdownOnExit​(boolean regularShutdown)
      Makes this executor shut down automatically when the JVM is exiting gracefully.
      boolean removeShutdownOnExit()
      Stops this executor from shutting down automatically when the JVM is exiting gracefully.
      boolean willShutdownOnExit()
      Gets whether this executor will shut down automatically when the JVM exits gracefully.
      boolean willShutdownRegularlyOnExit()
      Gets whether this executor will shut down regularly (ie: using ExecutorService.shutdown()) when the JVM exits gracefully.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.concurrent.Executor

        execute

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService

        awaitTermination, invokeAll, invokeAll, invokeAny, invokeAny, isShutdown, isTerminated, shutdown, shutdownNow, submit, submit, submit

    • Method Detail

      • addShutdownOnExit

        boolean addShutdownOnExit​(boolean regularShutdown)
        Makes this executor shut down automatically when the JVM is exiting gracefully.
        Parameters:
        regularShutdown - Whether to call ExecutorService.shutdown() or ExecutorService.shutdownNow() when exiting. True to call ExecutorService.shutdown(). False to call ExecutorService.shutdownNow().
        Returns:
        True if done successfully. False if the executor was already made to shut down automatically with the same shutdown option previously.

      • removeShutdownOnExit

        boolean removeShutdownOnExit()
        Stops this executor from shutting down automatically when the JVM is exiting gracefully.
        Returns:
        True if stopped successfully. False if the executor was never set to shut down automatically on JVM exit.

      • willShutdownOnExit

        boolean willShutdownOnExit()
        Gets whether this executor will shut down automatically when the JVM exits gracefully.
        Returns:
        Whether this executor will shut down automatically when the JVM exits gracefully.
        See Also:
        addShutdownOnExit(boolean), removeShutdownOnExit()

      • willShutdownRegularlyOnExit

        boolean willShutdownRegularlyOnExit()
        Gets whether this executor will shut down regularly (ie: using ExecutorService.shutdown()) when the JVM exits gracefully.
        Returns:
        Whether this executor will shut down regularly (ie: using ExecutorService.shutdown()) when the JVM exits gracefully. True if the executor will shut down using ExecutorService.shutdown() on JVM exit. False if it will use ExecutorService.shutdownNow() or the executor won't shut down automatically.
